window)Threads Click to print (Opens in new window)Print Little Rock nativeAshlie Atkinson, a Brooklyn-based actress who still manages an unrivaled loyalty to Arkansas, is starring in a new film, and a teaser trailer dropped a few days ago. Directed by Paul Greengrass (“Captian Phillips,” “The Bourne Ultimatum”) and produced by Jamie Lee Curtis, “The Lost Bus” is a dramatization of the 2018 Camp Fire, the deadliest and most destructive wildfire in California history. The film focuses on a bus driver played by Matthew McConaughey who’s tasked with rescuing 23 stranded elementary school students and their teacher (America Ferrera). The trailer is artfully sparse when it comes to details (minus a harrowing glimpse of McConaughey’s school bus weaving through a flame-drenched thicket of trees), but if you listen closely, you’ll recognize Atkinson’s voice as the calm yet authoritative radio dispatcher asking if anyone can “go and pick these kids up.” Check it out below: According toDeadline, “The Lost Bus” is based on the book “Paradise: One Town’s Struggle to Survive an American Wildfire.” The film is set to release on Apple TV+ and in select theaters in the fall. **It's dragon-slaying time!** In a time when critical voices are increasingly silenced, theArkansas Timesstands as a beacon of truth, tirelessly defending the fundamental rights and freedoms within our community. With Arkansas at the epicenter of a sweeping culture war affecting our libraries, schools, and public discourse, our mission to deliver unflinching journalism has never been more vital. We’re here to “slay dragons” and hold power accountable, but we can’t do it alone. By contributing today, you ensure that independent journalism not only survives but thrives in Arkansas.
